storyInfo: The retired soldier who stole the crown willingly appears before Vina, attempting to persuade her to become the king she envisioned. Yet Vina chooses to leave the throne vacant, with the crown resting upon it.

attributes.text: I don't like the throne room in the Palace of Westhaleg. It's so empty and bleak.
\nThat lonely throne just sitting there—I can't imagine what it'd be like if Vina actually sat on it.
\nOne woman, on that cold, lifeless chair, staring at the barren steps...
Knowing Vina, she wouldn't last a minute there—I'd bet on it.

attributes.content: <p=1>Throne Room, Palace of Westhaleg</><p=2>December 23, 1098, 3:26 A.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Did you find the crown? Where is it?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We didn't find it, per se. Someone delivered it to the Speaker's office. We can't determine the precise time it was lost, but we're fairly certain it happened after your speech started.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Vina already placed the crown on that empty throne... so what's the point of stealing it? Was it an order from the dukes?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I don't think so.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The dukes are never of one mind—they each have their own agenda. However, for the crown to go missing at the same time they're visiting Londinium? That's far too much of a coincidence.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But, according to what you've told us, isn't that crown just an old, rusted hunk of iron now?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: ....Umm, not exactly, Morgan.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: To many people, the crown is extraordinarily important, no matter its current state.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It's been left untouched for over twenty years, but the people have not forgotten about it. In fact, they are more eager than ever for its return.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: They're waiting for a wise new monarch to put it on his/her head, someone who can dispel the shadows hanging over Victoria.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No, most people are just desperate for a miracle—something that can satisfy their craving for royal authority.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I cannot deny that. Plus, you have listened to their voices for ages, Vina.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Your identity is truly unique: a descendant of the royal family and a bona fide war hero who was nonetheless raised on the streets. It's no wonder so many people naturally feel drawn to you.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Now that Parliament is up and running and the dukes have willingly relinquished their authority, the people are all the more convinced that you've secured universal support.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The next step is plain as day.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But the dukes have no intentions of doing anything like that!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The public only cares about the outcome, Morgan.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Yes… I've understood that since the day we returned home. Unfortunately, sometimes, I'm still very good at letting people down.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: <p=1>New Auchterigg Streets</><p=2>December 23, 1098, 4:59 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Thank you for sharing the energy bars, Eliseo. I'll gladly undergo daily sampling, if I get tasty treats like this every time. Haha.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Are these really things you can just buy off the shelf in Columbia? Why do you Columbians stock up on stuff like this—is it for Catastrophe or something?
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: These bars are my own personal thing.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: 'Food is fuel.' It's about energy and nutrition. Energy bars are convenient, so why not?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Then again, Diane definitely disagrees with me on this. She's more of a foodie.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I understand. We're thankful just to fill our bellies in Londinium these days.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Her Royal Highness Alexandrina has worked very hard to ensure that we have enough food to eat.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Quit yapping his ear off, will you?
attributes.name: Impatient Citizen

attributes.content: Thank you, Eliseo, for these...uh...'energy bars,' but we'd best be on our way now.
attributes.name: Impatient Citizen

attributes.content: Stanley, you're not afraid that Eliseo will...?
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Of course not!
attributes.name: Impatient Citizen

attributes.content: I... surely I can't be arguing with you about such stupid things in front of someone else, right? It's not proper.
attributes.name: Impatient Citizen

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: *sigh* He doesn't like when I refer to Alexandrina as 'Her Royal Highness', That's all.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: He and I don't see eye to eye politically. I think having a king again wouldn't be half bad, but he insists life was worse for us when the monarchy was still in power.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: But think about it, whether it was back then, or right now, aren't we managing to get by all the same?
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: So you're saying the presence of a monarch doesn't really impact your life all that much?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: It doesn't matter what she thinks. Even if someone does ascend the throne again, it's not like we'll be invited to the coronation feast.
attributes.name: Impatient Citizen

attributes.content: *sigh* Stanley, when are you going to come up with an argument that actually convinces me?
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Sorry about this, Eliseo. I need to talk some sense into this stubborn mule.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Oh, by the way, about the increased patrols in the city—I've heard a rumor. Supposedly, someone stole the crown, and the Defense Forces are investigating anyone who might be connected with the theft.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Let's go, Stanley. Goodbye, Eliseo.
attributes.name: Carefree Citizen

attributes.content: Come to think of it, Diane has never mentioned the king or the crown, not even once. Maybe I should ask her about it when I get back.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Eliseo, you should take a break. You've been working nearly nonstop, helping collect patient data.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: The city's Infected all experienced acute infection around the same time, with many showing rare pathological progressions. I need to document this valuable data thoroughly.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Whether it's for future research into Oripathy or for developing targeted treatments for Londinium's citizens, this data is critically important.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: By the way, Sarah, why didn't Diane visit you today?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Diane?
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: I thought she was helping you. Many of my old comrades came by the sanatorium today. They wanted to ask if anything 'unusual' had come up recently. We were hoping to bring Diane along for a little reunion with them.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.text: Throughout the whole war, Vina never told us where she found that crown.
\nBut it didn't matter. None of us cared, and no one would ever see that hunk of iron again.
\nIt was supposed to remain sealed in the throne room in the Palace of Westhaleg, left to corrode and decay into nothing.
'The Age of Kings is over and done.'
\nThat's what a drunken Vina said to me, with her arm slung around my neck.
\nAnd yet, barely two months later, here it is again, staring us in the face—The ghost of this ancient empire refuses to let go. It's always ready to claim its next victim.

attributes.content: <p=1>Speaker's Office</><p=2>December 24th, 1098, 6:26 A.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Does anyone else know about this?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We've taken steps to contain the information and will do everything we can to minimize its impact.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: So... what do we do with this thing?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan points at the battered crown sitting on the desk.
This is my first time seeing it up close. Can't believe so many people are fretting over this old thing...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina... Vina?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She notices that Vina isn't looking at the crown at all. Instead, she's standing silently by the desk, her gaze fixed on the dejected figure sitting in the chair across from her—
'The one who stole the crown'.
You really have no questions for me, Madam Speaker?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I reckon many of you have fanciful notions about me.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Besides, my colleagues will soon have a more complete and objective report delivered to my desk, regarding this matter. So—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Don't lump me in with those people! All they care about is the throne itself. I care about the one on the throne.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I know exactly what I'm doing. I'm well aware of every new law Parliament has enacted, Speaker Vina. Unauthorized entry into the throne chamber is indeed a serious crime, and I'm not planning to deny anything.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Vina shakes her head.
But that doesn't mean you're fundamentally different from those people. The provisional court will try your case according to the law.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Do you have any further objections?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No, Madam Speaker.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Delphine, I'll leave the rest to you. I'll personally return the crown to the throne room and make sure security is tightened up.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: *sigh* And then I need to prepare the report for the council meeting—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Heh... a report.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: You didn't have to do all this, Siege. You know all too well how inefficient Parliament is—it's just a group of individuals all looking out for their own self-interest.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: You must already be exhausted, just from dealing with all those MPs, no?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Londinium has no need for a Speaker operating at the whims of Parliament. What Londinium needs is a real, absolute leader who can guide the city through its transformation.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Vina, there's no point in arguing with her about this meaningless stuff.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I know, Delphine. Madam, are you suggesting that Londinium needs a dictator?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No. I'm talking about a king. Victoria needs a king.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I can guess what you want to do, Madam Speaker. You're unlike any ruler I've ever known.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: You don't even care about your own lineage. But if you wish to achieve your vision, 'Speaker', it won't be enough. This crown should not, and will not, become an obstacle to you.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: She stands up, giving Vina a crisp salute.
That is all I have to say on this matter.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I give my thanks to The Exemplars, and The Siege, for all you've done for our homeland.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I'm fond of the changes she's undergone and firmly believe she'll become an even better leader in future.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: It's just a shame that her transformation is still so slow... I won't live to see that day myself.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Let's go, Lady Delphine. Where should we head next?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.text: 'Do you really know what I wish to do?'
'You want to change Victoria...'
'No. You want to defeat her. You want to defeat the Victoria of the past.'

attributes.content: Vina stands at the foot of the staircase, holding the crown in her hands as she gazes at the throne.
Beside the throne, a golden lion lays sprawled, his eyelids drooping halfway.
Gawain, you should've told me sooner.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Step by step, she ascends the staircase until she reaches the throne. Instead of sitting on it, she sits on the steps before it.
The lion doesn't seem to open his eyes. His gentle breath brushes through its mane, sending up faint specks of dust.
He is displeased.
I'm sorry, Gawain. I had another sleepless night. There are still so many thorny issues left unresolved...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She feels the warmth at her back. The golden lion has moved closer, and his massive body is now supporting her.
Just like it had when she was a child. Vina catches a whiff of sunlight.
Gawain, how nice it would be to fall asleep leaning against you like this.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Walking all the way back here from outside the city feels like... a dream...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But it's been so long since I've had a good night's sleep, let alone a deep, satisfying dream.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The lion lifts his head slightly, brushing against Vina's golden hair, tickling her just enough to make her smile faintly.
The chill in the air sends a shiver through her, jolting her back to clarity.
...Has it always been this cold here? It's not time to rest yet, is it?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What we're doing now still falls far short. There's not enough medicine, not enough food, and endless arguments—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Sometimes I wish I could just rip off this uniform and knock those idiots down one by one. Maybe things would be much simpler that way, huh?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: 'Defeat the Victoria of the past'...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: If only it were as simple as a match in the ring.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The golden lion closes his eyes, drifting off to sleep, though his tail is still lazily swatting against Vina's arm.
Teacher, I'm sorry for complaining to you again.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There are some things I don't know how to explain to Morgan and the others. They wouldn't understand, and I don't want to make them worry.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: As for Delphine... I don't want to show too much doubt or vulnerability in front of her. She's already taken on so much for me and pinned so many expectations on me.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There are already so many people counting on me, Gawain.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I don't want to let them down.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She shuts her eyes and grips the crown.
'King', 'Speaker', these titles mean nothing to her.
She just wants—

attributes.name: Morgan
attributes.content: Vina, I knew I'd find you here!

attributes.name: Morgan
attributes.content: Wait… were you just asleep, or?
No, I was just thinking about something. Gawain, he—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She instinctively turns her head to the side, but there's no one there. Yet that warmth remains, unmistakable.
He's gone.
(...Thank you for being here with me, Gawain.)
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Morgan, what are you doing here?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Delphine convinced the provisional court to hold the crown thief in the Defense Forces' detention quarters, for now.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The full report on her is out now. I didn't want to waste time, so I came straight to you. Here, this is the report.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Her name is Diane Weber.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan pauses, watching Vina closely for a reaction. But Vina simply looks at her with curiosity, waiting for her to continue.
She didn't just decide to steal the crown out of the blue.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She has been working with a pharmaceutical rep from Columbia for a while now, helping spread awareness about Oripathy infection protection methods.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That's how she learned when the guards patrolling outside the Palace of Westhaleg would change shifts. Once she got inside, she waited until your speech and slipped into the throne room.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: And then, she stayed there for quite a while—at least half an hour.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What did she do in there?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I don't know, and she won't say. Maybe she was hesitating, or maybe she just got lost in thought. In any case, she managed to make off with the crown without alerting anyone.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Wait, something doesn't add up here. She stayed in the throne chamber for so long. She didn't run into the patrols after the shift change?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No, she didn't. Even she was surprised by how easily she escaped. She thought for sure the patrols would catch her.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: So someone must have helped her. Was it one of the guests?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Unclear, but if she had help, she didn't know about it. She came up with this whole plan herself.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But... why? Just to bring the crown to me and goad me into—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Her name is Diane Weber.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I know—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You don't remember her. I kept thinking she looked familiar, and when I saw the report, I realized—it's her.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Remember that day when the alliance surrounded us on our doorstep? The first soldier to defy orders and escort us forward?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina recalled the sky that day, filled with steam, the lingering smell of smoke and gunpowder.
And the soldier whose face had become a blur in her memory.

attributes.text: 'This is Lieutenant Diane Weber of the Sixth Column, Tenth Infantry Regiment. Lower your weapons, soldiers, and escort the Exemplars in their advance.'
'Before I was a soldier, I was a Londinier. This is my home too.'
'Go, Siege. The fight is not yet over.'
'We will take back what is ours!'

attributes.content: Diane Weber, the soldier who defied the Duke of Caster's orders... She contracted an acute infection in the final battle against the Nachzehrer King.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That rings a bell? She was the one who took the Sighs of Kings from you and charged towards the Nachzehrers.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She doesn't have much time left.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We are short of Oripathy suppressants, and she never got enough medicine to slow her condition. We took a look at her, but—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The crown lets out a faint metallic creak as Vina's hand tightens around it. It looks so fragile, yet its resilience is undeniable.
She really loved our home, and she loved Victoria as well.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That's why she volunteered to join the ducal forces, only to defy their orders and end up forced into retirement.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She trusted you, even though I don't agree with some of her ideas. Vina, maybe we could...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: I never finished asking for mercy on Diane's behalf. Vina knew what I wanted to say, and I knew how she'd respond...
\nNo, I knew what Speaker Vina Victoria would say.
\nEven now, I can't imagine what must've been going through Diane Weber's head when she made that crazy decision, but I admire her.
...Even though she stole the crown, she did it out of love for Victoria.
\nI don't understand. Since coming back to the city, so many things have changed—changed in ways I can't fathom and don't want to understand.
\nAnd on that day, I finally made up my mind—
From the end of that final battle outside the Palace of Westhaleg until now... I've lingered here far too long.
\nMaybe it's time to go home, back to the boxing gym.
